actions.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure.

actions.committee: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources
actions.text: Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

actions.in_committee: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources
actions.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources Subcommittee on National Parks, Historic Preservation, and Recreation. Hearings held. With printed Hearing: S.Hrg. 106-594.

actions.in_committee: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources
actions.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator Murkowski without amendment. With written report No. 106-262.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 492.
Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Received in the House.
Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks and Public Lands.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.
Reported by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 106-749.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 430.
Mr. Simpson moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 1705.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Cleared for White House.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 106-421.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on National Parks, Historic Preservation and Recreation
Subcommittee on National Parks and Public Lands

official_title: A bill to direct the Secretary of the Interior to enter into land exchanges to acquire from the private owner and to convey to the State of Idaho approximately 1,240 acres of land near the City of Rocks National Reserve, Idaho, and for other purposes.
short_title: Castle Rock Ranch Acquisition Act of 2000

summary.text: Castle Rock Ranch Acquisition Act of 1999 - Directs the Secretary of the Interior to: (1) acquire Castle Rock Ranch in Idaho, but only with the land owner's consent; and (2) convey the Ranch to the State of Idaho in exchange for specified land near Hagerman, Idaho, located within the boundary of the Hagerman Fossil Beds National Monument, to be administered as part of the Monument.Permits the State to exchange portions of the Ranch for private land within the Reserve, with the consent of the owners of the private land. Requires the State to administer private land acquired within the Reserve in accordance with the Arizona-Idaho Conservation Act of 1988.

titles.title: Castle Rock Ranch Acquisition Act of 1999
Castle Rock Ranch Acquisition Act of 2000

A bill to direct the Secretary of the Interior to enter into land exchanges to acquire from the private owner and to convey to the State of Idaho approximately 1,240 acres of land near the City of Rocks National Reserve, Idaho, and for other purposes.
